si.title: වාහන ආනයනය සඳහා ගැසට් ප්රතිදානය
body_lines: රජයට අත්යවශ්ය වාහන ආනයනය කිරීම සඳහා නව ගැසට් පත්රය මුදා හැර ඇති බව මුදල් අමාත්ය රංජිත් සියම්බලපිටිය මහතා පැවසීය.

பொதுவாக வாகனங்களை இறக்குமதி செய்வதற்கு வர்த்தமானி அறிவித்தல் வெளியிடப்படவில்லை என்றும், சில அரச நிறுவனங்களின் சில அத்தியாவசிய நடவடிக்கைகளுக்காக சில வாகனங்களை இறக்குமதி செய்வதற்கு மாத்திரமே இந்த வர்த்தமானி அறிவித்தல் வெளியிடப்பட்டுள்ளதாகவும் இராஜாங்க அமைச்சர் தெரிவித்தார்.

විදේශ අරමුදල් ව්යාපෘති භාවිතා කරමින් වාහන ආනයනය කරනු ලබන අතර, එම සැලසුම් යටතේ සෞඛ්ය අමාත්යාංශය සහ බස්රථ 3 ක් සහ බස් රථ 3 ක් සෞඛ්ය අමාත්යාංශයට බස් දෙකක් ලබා ගනී.. ජංගම ගුහා සායන සඳහා කම්කරු අමාත්යාංශයට සහ කම්කරු අමාත්යාංශයට වාහනයක් ලබා දෙන බව ද ඔහු පැවසීය.
ශ්රී ලංකන් ගුවන් සමාගමට වාහන 3 ක් ශ්රී ලංකන් ගුවන් සමාගමට සහ අනෙකුත් සියලුම වාහනවලට විදේශ ආධාර ලබා දෙන බව රාජ්ය නායක රංජිත් සියම්බලපිටිය මහතා පැවසීය.

en.title: Gazette output for vehicle imports
body_lines: Finance Minister Ranjith Siyambalapitiya has said that the new gazette has been released to import only essential vehicles to the government.

The Minister of State said that the gazette notification has not been issued for the importation of vehicles, and that the gazette notification has been issued only to import some vehicles for some essential activities of some state agencies.

Vehicles will be imported using foreign funding projects, and under those plans, the Ministry of Education will get two buses, 21 double carts for the Ministry of Health and 3 buses to the Ministry of Health.. He also said that a vehicle will be given to the Ministry of Labor and Labor for Mobile Mystery Clinics.

The Minister of State Ranjith Siyambalapitiya has said that 3 vehicles will be imported to SriLankan Airlines and all other vehicles other than the SriLankan Airlines will be provided with foreign assistance.

summary_lines: Finance Minister Ranjith Siyambalapitiya announced a new gazette for importing only essential vehicles for government use. Essential vehicles will be funded by foreign projects, with specific allocations for the Ministry of Education, Health, and Labor. SriLankan Airlines will receive 3 vehicles, while other vehicles will be aided by foreign assistance.
